title: The Shepherd's Care
verses:
O, tell me the place where thy flock are at rest,
Where the noontide will find them reposing;
The tempest now rages, my soul is distressed,
And the darkness around me is closing.

O, why must I dwell with the hosts of thy foes,
'Mid the desert where now they are roving,
Where hunger and thirst, where afflictions and woes,
And lies now their ruin are proving?
O, when shall my exile and wanderings cease,
And the troubles that fill me with weeping?

metadata.theological_significance: Expresses longing for divine guidance and protection in troubled times
